data.title: Sen. Kelly Elected Chair of United States Merchant Marine Academy Board of Visitors
data.meta_description: Kelly is the first ever USMMA alumnus to serve in Congress Today, Arizona Senator and U.S. Merchant Marine Academy (USMMA) alumnus Mark Kelly was unanimously elected as Chair of the USMMA Board of Visitors for the 118th Congress during a meeting of the board. Kelly, who graduated from the USMMA in 1986 and went on […]
data.text:
Kelly is the first ever USMMA alumnus to serve in Congress

Today, Arizona Senator and U.S. Merchant Marine Academy (USMMA) alumnus Mark Kelly was unanimously elected as Chair of the USMMA Board of Visitors for the 118th Congress during a meeting of the board. Kelly, who graduated from the USMMA in 1986 and went on to serve 25 years in the U.S. Navy, is the first ever USMMA alumnus to serve in Congress.

“As the first USMMA graduate to serve in Congress, I am honored to have been chosen for this responsibility. For our economy and our national security, we need a strong Merchant Marine—and that means a strong U.S. Merchant Marine Academy. I am eager to get to work on addressing the many challenges facing the Academy, including rebuilding campus infrastructure, and creating a safe and effective learning environment to meet our commercial and military maritime needs,” said Kelly.

Background
